channel.title: Recent and Upcoming Public Talks & Workshops on BinaryMist
channel.description: Recent content in Recent and Upcoming Public Talks & Workshops on BinaryMist

item.title: Workshop - Planning and Covid
item.description: Planning for this years Meetup sessions followed by a discussion on Covid

item.title: Talk - Building purpleteam (a Security Regression Testing SaaS) - From PoC to Alpha
item.description: Developers / Engineers know that a build pipeline is an essential part of creating robust and reliable software, but what to put in it? This talk covers the creation of purpleteam from PoC to Alpha release, and why it’s an ideal fit for the security regression testing slot of your build pipeline.

item.title: Workshop - Init Security Titans
item.description: Workshop to initialise, train and deploy the Jade Security Champions across the Jade Development Teams.

item.title: Talk - Hardening Your Docker Infrastructure
item.description: The security defaults of Docker are designed to get you up and running (“just work”) quickly, rather than being the most secure. There are many default configurations that can be improved upon. In this talk Kim will walk through improving the security of Docker hosts, containers, networking and deployments.

item.title: Talk - Security Regression Testing on OWASP Zap Node API
item.description: The OWASP ZAP HTTP intercepting proxy is useful for manually attacking your Web apps and APIs. Now, we have the official Node API to programatically drive ZAP to regression test our creations. Kim will show you how to build a fully featured security regression testing CLI, consumable by your CI/nightly builds.

item.title: Conference - Christchurch Hacker Con
item.description: CHCon 2018: A conference for security professionals and hackers in Christchurch, NZ.

item.title: Conference - OWASP New Zealand Day
item.description: The eighth OWASP New Zealand Day conference, held at the University of Auckland.

item.title: Workshop - Building Security Into Your Development Teams
item.description: Kim’s flagship Software Developer focussed training, this time at OWASP New Zealand Day conference.

item.title: Talk - Secrets of a High Performance Security Focussed Agile Team
item.description: At BSides Wellington: Kim discusses that Quality (security included) does not have to be neglected when you’re planning, building and running a high performance development team. He discusses how we fail and how to succeed.

item.title: Conference - Christchurch Hacker Con
item.description: CHCon 2017: A conference for security professionals and hackers, based in Christchurch, NZ.

item.title: Workshop - Building Security Into Your Development Teams
item.description: Kim’s flagship Software Developer focussed training, this time at Christchurch Hacker Conference (CHCon).

item.title: Talk - Secrets of a High Performance Security Focussed Agile Team
item.description: Kim discusses how and why Agile Development Teams fail at security, and how to stop failing.

item.title: Workshop - Web Developer Quiz Night
item.description: Attacking a set of carefully curated questions around info-sec, white hat, black hat, attack and defense.

item.title: Conference - OWASP New Zealand Day
item.description: The eighth OWASP New Zealand Day conference, held at the University of Auckland.

item.title: Talk - The Art of Exploitation
item.description: At JS Remote Conf: Kim examines and demonstrates a collection of essential attacks, commonly used in the exploitation and demise of many individuals and organisations today.

item.title: Talk - The Art of Exploitation
item.description: At NZ.JS: Kim examines and demonstrates a collection of essential attacks, commonly used in the exploitation and demise of many individuals and organisations today.

item.title: Workshop - Developing a high-performance security focussed Agile Team
item.description:
DevSecCon, Singapore: Quality (security included) does not have to be neglected when you’re planning, building and running a high-performance development team.

Kim will set the stage with how and why Agile development teams fail, explained with a familiar anecdote taken from his new book “Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers”, coupled with how you can change this.

item.title: Workshop - Windows Exploitation and Persistence with PowerShell
item.description: Kim will walk us through a collection of PowerShell delivery (RAM, not disk) techniques for a common reverse shellcode.

item.title: Talk - Agile Security for Web Developers
item.description: Join Kim at AgileNZ 2016 for an exploration into an insightful set of steps he has learned, from an architectural, engineering and penetration testing perspective.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers - Intense
item.description: Kiwicon hands-on threat modelling, attack and defence strategy training for Web Developers wishing to understand their attackers better, stay ahead of them and create cost effective defence strategies.

item.title: Conference - Christchurch Hacker Con
item.description: CHCon 2016: A conference for security professionals and hackers in Christchurch, NZ.

item.title: Workshop - Security Regression Testing with ZapAPI and NodeGoat
item.description: At AWS Auckland, Kim will demonstrate the OWASP Zap API with NodeGoat, which helps you identify vulnerabilities in your web application as you create it, rather than at the end of a project.

item.title: Workshop - Security Regression Testing with ZapAPI and NodeGoat
item.description: NodeJS Auckland: Kim will demonstrate the OWASP Zap API with NodeGoat, which helps you identify vulnerabilities in your web application as you create it, rather than at the end of a project.

item.title: Workshop - Security Regression Testing with ZapAPI and NodeGoat
item.description: This time in Kilkenny of Ireland, Kim will demonstrate the OWASP Zap API with NodeGoat, which helps you identify vulnerabilities in your web application as you create it, rather than at the end of a project.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Computer Science Students
item.description: This time for the students of University of Canterbury. An exploration into an insightful set of steps he has learned, from an architectural, engineering and penetration testing perspective. Based on the content of volume 0 & 1 of Kim’s new book “Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers”. This time held at the University of Canterbury.

item.description: Join Kim at Agile Professionals Network for an exploration into an insightful set of steps he has learned, from an architectural, engineering and penetration testing perspective.

item.description: This time in New York City at OWASP, Kim will demonstrate the OWASP Zap API with NodeGoat, which helps you identify vulnerabilities in your web application as you create it, rather than at the end of a project.

An exploration into an insightful set of steps he has learned, from an architectural, engineering and penetration testing perspective. Based on the content of volume 0 & 1 of Kim’s new book “Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers”.

item.description: Kim will demonstrate the OWASP Zap API with NodeGoat at the meetup he usually facilitates, which helps you identify vulnerabilities in your web application as you create it, rather than at the end of a project.

item.description: At CHC.js Kim will demonstrate the OWASP Zap API with NodeGoat, which helps you identify vulnerabilities in your web application as you create it, rather than at the end of a project.

item.title: Talk - Agile Security for Web Developers
item.description: Join Kim at CodeCamp Christchurch for an exploration into an insightful set of steps he has learned, from an architectural, engineering and penetration testing perspective.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description: AusCERT hands-on threat modelling, attack and defence strategy training for Web Developers wishing to understand their attackers better, stay ahead of them and create cost effective defence strategies.

item.title: Workshop - Tools, Password Profiling, Brute Forcing
item.description: Kim will take ISIG through the collection of tools added and configured on his penetration testing machine used throughout his book series (Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers). Kim will then profile a well known celebrities password, creating a short-list, then (on-line) brute force their login. Come along, it’ll be fun.

item.title: Conference - OWASP New Zealand Day
item.description: The seventh OWASP New Zealand Day conference, held at the University of Auckland.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description: Kiwicon hands-on threat modelling, attack and defence strategy training for Web Developers wishing to understand their attackers better, stay ahead of them and create cost effective defence strategies.

item.title: Talk - Password Profiling, Brute Forcing
item.description: Kim talks with his fellow Toastmasters about profiling peoples passwords and then brute forcing web applications with the shortlist of guessed passwords..

item.title: Talk - Infectious Media with Rubber Ducky
item.description: Kim talks with his fellow Toastmasters about the risks and countermeasures of luring targets to execute infectious media on their devices.

item.title: Talk - The Exploited & the Exploiters
item.description: Taking the perspective of the penetration tester hired in by the target to find the defects in their security defences before the cyber criminals do.

item.title: Talk - 0wn1ng The Web
item.description: At Functional Christchurch, due to popular demand. Taking the perspective of the penetration tester hired in by the target to find the defects in their security defences before the cyber criminals do.

item.title: Talk - 0wn1ng The Web
item.description: At Test Professionals Network Christchurch, due to popular demand. Taking the perspective of the penetration tester hired in by the target to find the defects in their security defences before the cyber criminals do.

item.title: Talk - 0wn1ng The Web
item.description: At CHCH.js Christchurch, due to popular demand. Taking the perspective of the penetration tester hired in by the target to find the defects in their security defences before the cyber criminals do.

item.title: Talk - 0wn1ng The Web
item.description: At WDCNZ: Kim discusses and demonstrates how JavaScript can be used for good and evil.

item.title: Talk - Does Your Cloud Solution Look Like a Mushroom
item.description: At Dot Net User Group, Christchurch, due to popular demand this presentation is being run again. Drawing from Kim’s recent blog post “Journey to Self Hosting” and many more resources for some high-level ideas about cloud solutions. Kim will discuss what’s good and what’s not good about “the Cloud”.

item.title: Talk - Does Your Cloud Solution Look Like a Mushroom
item.description: At OWASP meetup, Christchurch, due to popular demand this presentation is being run again. Drawing from Kim’s recent blog post “Journey to Self Hosting” and many more resources for some high-level ideas about cloud solutions. Kim will discuss what’s good and what’s not good about “the Cloud”.

item.title: Talk - Passwords 101
item.description: In this 5 – 7 minute talk, Kim demonstrates (hands on) how easy it can be to compromise passwords using a collection of techniques. Kim discusses how most developers are failing at keeping their end users safe.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description: At CampJS, Melbourne, Australia: Join Kim in the exploration into an insightful set of steps he has learned, from an architectural perspective down to the zeros and ones. Also providing insights of how attackers of your systems think.

item.title: Talk - Does Your Cloud Solution Look Like a Mushroom
item.description: Saturn Architect Conference, Baltimore, MD, USA: Drawing from Kim’s recent blog post “Journey to Self Hosting” and many more resources for some high-level ideas about cloud solutions. Kim will discuss what’s good and what’s not good about “the Cloud”.

item.title: Conference - OWASP New Zealand Day
item.description: The sixth OWASP New Zealand Day conference, held at the University of Auckland.

item.title: Talk - How to Increase Software Developer Productivity
item.description: At AgileNZ: Are you looking to get more out of your organisation’s software developers, increase your ROI, spend less money on fixing bugs or increase your development team’s business value and release rate? If so, this session is for you.

item.title: Workshop - Writing an Ember.JS Application
item.description: At CHC.js Kim will demonstrate write a blogging platform in JavaScript using Ember.js. The application had the functionality to display, edit and navigate blog posts written in markdown in about 35 lines of JavaScript on top of the handlebars templates.

item.title: Talk - What's Our Software Doing With All That User Input
item.description: At OWASP NZ Day: What are we doing with all the characters that get shoved into our applications? Have we considered every potential execution context?

item.title: Workshop - Security Testing with Kim Carter
item.description: At ANZTB: Hands-on insight into security testing. Kim will discuss some of the more common security vulnerabilities being found in today’s software implementations, and will demonstrate ways of testing them.

item.title: Talk - Moving to test and behaviour-driven development
item.description: At Canterbury Software Cluster: In this session Kim went over the benefits of introducing TDD and BDD: How to introduce them, their differences, how to deal with push back from team members and upper management.

item.title: Workshop - Pearls For Improving Operational Efficiency
item.description: This was a presentation held at one of TSBCs Sprint Reviews after attending a Clarus Professional Scrum Master course.
